div.p: This operation is used to parse and store a received FHIR Clinical Document.

As described in Special Topic Immutable and parseable clinical documents, FHIR Clinical Documents are used in a number of different ways, where users may need to store a received document as an immutable object and/or parse a received document to extract observations and other entries. Parsing a received clinical document can entail not only processing all of the resources that it contains as individual resources, but may also entail assessing each object's revision status such that a server correctly supersedes previously obtained objects with newly received amended objects.
This IG further expands on the Document End-Points discussion in FHIR Documents by providing a FHIR Operation that encapsulates the complexity of parsing a received clinical document.

Implementation considerations:
A relatively simple implementation may choose to ignore revision management, and directly parse and store all bundled objects. This may be achieved by processing the document bundle to: (1) Revise Bundle.type to “transaction”; (2) Ensure references within the bundle are not pointing to resource.id, but instead are pointing to a resource instance’s full URL or other unique identifier; (3) Set Bundle.entry.request.method to “POST”.
A more complex implementation can process FHIR Clinical Document replacement semantics as described in Special Topic Clinical document succession management.
An even more complex implementation can process replacement semantics of other bundled resources such as observations. It would be reasonable in such an implementation for a server to specify requirements for how such replacement semantics are to be represented (e.g. where Observation.status is 'amended', the Observation is replacing Observations with a similar Observation.identifier and an earlier Observation.effectiveDateTime).
